newsitem.title: USA: El Paso files Tenneco pipeline cost pact.
newsitem.headline: El Paso files Tenneco pipeline cost pact.

text.p: El Paso Energy Corp said Friday it filed a settlement with the Federal Energy Regular Commission (FERC) intended to resolve the issue of transition costs for its Tennessee Gas Pipeline Co's recovery of Order Number 636.

The filing seeks to cap the cost to Tennessee Gas's customers at $1.185 billion. The settlement provides a sliding scale of sharing, with customers responsible for about 65 percent of the total transition costs, El Paso said. Tennessee Gas is responsible for the balance of the costs.
El Paso Energy said the settlement was in line with its expectations and not expected to affect its earnings.
El Paso Energy said the pact was negotiated with, and is expected to be supported by, all Tennessee Gas customers, state regulatory agencies and FERC.
The setttlement will have fixed-rate structure in place until October 2000, and rate certainty through October 2005, the company said.
